<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 20"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Codex of Destruction and Renewal](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2173)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Grimoire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=387" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 111 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 70,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

An unsmiling mask, half obsidian and half ivory, is embossed on the cover of this weighty tome, the opposite color forming the background of each half. Each _codex of destruction and renewal_ is said to contain a fragment of the knowledge [Nethys](/Deities.aspx?ID=12) gained in his apotheosis and they're sacred to his church.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [spellshape](/Traits.aspx?ID=513)) **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** If your next action is to cast a damage-dealing spell prepared from this grimoire, the spell wreaks even greater destruction. The spell ignores 10 [resistance](/Rules.aspx?ID=2318) and you reroll any damage dice that roll a 1. If the spell reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, they’re torn apart at an infinitesimal level, not even leaving a fine ash; this is a [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effect.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561), [spellshape](/Traits.aspx?ID=513)) **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** If your next action is to cast a [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=623) spell prepared from this grimoire that restores Hit Points, the spell renews the target constantly and perfectly. The spell grants the target [regeneration](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=72) 20, restoring 20 Hit Points at the start of its turn and preventing the target both from [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=69) due to damage and from its dying condition increasing to a value that would result in its death. Each time the creature regains Hit Points from regeneration, it regrows all damaged or ruined organs; it can also regrow any severed body parts as a free action immediately after the body part is severed, with the original crumbling to ash. The effect lasts for 4 rounds.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Codex of Destruction and Renewal
